pageContext.other: Last two publications were in a different hand and in pencil.,  Since weight is expressed in ounces, I am not sure if measurements are in millimeters or inches.
pageContext.publications: Proc. Soc. Ant. 2S II, 370, where it is described as from Helsington Peat Moss., ? Journ. Arch Ass. (Canrebury Meeig)?  1875, Kvans ABI p.  246
pageContext.site: England, Cumbria, Levens, Foulshaw Stakes Moss., Found while digging peat by Nicholas Gibson of Brathwaite Green, at a depth of about 6 feet, about 1855.
pageContext.remarks: The decoration is on both sides but very faint.  The butt appears to have been remodeled, and the dagger to have been longer with a wider butt, and several rivets.  The present hole seems to have been bored.
